I am not spending 100 weeks just to check something out. Plus, if you can't use /give to get it, you wouldn't be able to have it in your inventory and if you can't use /setblock to get it, it wouldn't be able to generate in your world at all. Plus, it should have a better use than just a material/decoration.

Running (or flying) should theoretically make it last longer (due to plenty of fresh oxygen to feed the flames) -- unless you're too high to breathe, but then you have a different problem.

Well its based off a glass people would use that I think is called Sheild. They use this just in case some object hits them and to protect them from extremely loud sounds.
This reminds me of plexiglass. Perhaps to nerf Plexiglass if it is added, maybe it would only go be a grayish glass.

Sure, why not? It could be explosion proof

What I'd find fun too is if it was even.light proof, so you're watching a dark room from.a lit one.

At the very least, I would make obsidian slightly transparent, as it is a type of glass. It could be made to only let some light through, although that could ruin the point of tinted glass. It could let light through but just be hard to see through

Maybe instead of being called Obsidian Glass it could be called Tempered Glass. This works well because it sounds good with Tinted Glass, along with the fact that obsidian is formed by lava, which alludes to the "tempered" part
